channel.title: CIHI Data Tables RSS Feed
channel.description: Updates on new data tables published by CIHI.

item.title: Pharmacists in Canada, 2024 — Data Tables
item.description: ​These data tables report on the supply, workforce, demographics, education and employment trends of Canada’s pharmacist workforce.

item.title: Physiotherapists in Canada, 2024 — Data Tables
item.description: These data tables report on the supply, workforce, demographics, education and employment trends of Canada’s physiotherapist workforce.

item.title: Occupational Therapists in Canada, 2024 — Data Tables
item.description: ​These data tables report on the supply, workforce, demographics, education and employment trends of Canada’s occupational therapist workforce.

item.title: National Physician Database Historical Payments, 1996-2023 — Data Tables
item.description: ​​​These data tables provide historical information on payments for physician services in Canada, using data from the National Physician Database (NPDB).

item.title: National Physician Database — Payments Data, 2023–2024
item.description: ​These data tables provide information on payments for physician services in Canada, using data from the National Physician Database (NPDB).

item.title: National Physician Database Historical Utilization, 1996 to 2013 — Data Tables
item.description: ​These data tables provide historical information on utilization of physician services in Canada, using data from the National Physician Database (NPDB).

item.title: National Physician Database — Utilization Data, 2023–2024
item.description: ​These data tables provide information on physician service utilization in Canada, using data from the National Physician Database (NPDB).

item.title: National Physician Database Historical Utilization, 2014-2023 — Data Tables
item.description: These data tables provide historical information on utilization of physician services in Canada, using data from the National Physician Database (NPDB).

item.title: Supply, Distribution and Migration of Physicians in Canada, 2024 — Data Tables
item.description: ​These data tables provide information on the supply and distribution of physicians in Canada by specialty, including demographic, education and migration information.

item.title: Supply, Distribution and Migration of Physicians in Canada, 1971-2000 — Historical Data
item.description: ​This table provides 30 years of supply and distribution data for physicians in Canada by specialty, including demographic, education and migration information.

item.title: DAD and NACRS Provisional Data Timeliness, 2025–2026 — Data Tables
item.description: These data tables provide metrics of the timeliness of 2025–2026 Discharge Abstract Database (DAD) and National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS) data.

item.title: Profile of Residents in Residential and Hospital-Based Continuing Care, 2024–2025
item.description: These data tables provide a profile of residents of submitting residential care (commonly known as long-term care homes) and hospital-based continuing care facilities in 2024–2025.

item.title: NACRS Emergency Department Visits and Lengths of Stay by Province/Territory, 2024–2025 (Q1 to Q4)
item.description: The final release of 2024–2025 information on emergency department (ED) visits and lengths of stay, based on data submitted to the National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS).

item.title: CIHI Mental Health and Substance Use Diagnosis Code Groupings for Selected Indicators
item.description: This table provides diagnosis code groupings used to categorize episodes of care to broad mental health and substance use disorder categories for selected publicly reported CIHI indicators.

item.title: DAD and NACRS Provisional Data Timeliness, 2025–2026 — Data Tables
item.description: These data tables provide metrics of the timeliness of 2025–2026 Discharge Abstract Database (DAD) and National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS) data.

item.title: Cost of a Standard Day in Long-Term Care, 2019–2020 to 2023–2024
item.description: These 2 data tables provide adjusted and unadjusted results for the Cost of a Standard Day (CSD) in Long-Term Care indicator for 2019–2020 to 2023–2024.

item.title: Nursing in Canada, 2024 — Data Tables
item.description: ​​​These data tables report on 10 years of supply, workforce, demographic, education and employment trends of Canada’s nursing workforce.

item.title: Injury and Trauma Emergency Department and Hospitalization Statistics, 2022–2023
item.description: Injury and Trauma Emergency Department and Hospitalization Statistics, 2022–2023

item.title: Injury and Trauma Emergency Department and Hospitalization Statistics, 2023–2024
item.description: ​Learn about emergency department (ED) visits and hospitalizations for injuries and trauma in Canada.

item.title: How Canada Compares: Results From the Commonwealth Fund’s 2024 International Health Policy Survey of Older Adults in 10 Countries — Data tables
item.description: This file contains Around 70 tables presenting results from the Commonwealth Fund's 2024 International Health Policy Survey of the general population age 65+, which was conducted in 10 countries.

item.title: Health Workforce in Canada, 2023 — Quick Stats
item.description: Interactive tool to visually compare trends for Canada’s health workforce by profession, plus vacancies and staffing indicators. Hospital staffing indicators updated as of June 26, 2025.

item.title: How Canada Compares: Results From the Commonwealth Fund’s 2024 International Health Policy Survey of Older Adults in 10 Countries — Quick Stats
item.description: 7 tables present selected results from the Commonwealth Fund's 2024 International Health Policy Survey of the general population age 65+, which was conducted in 10.

item.title: Wait Times for Priority Procedures in Canada, 2008 to 2024 — Data Tables
item.description: ​​This data table contains information on wait times for hip and knee replacements, hip fracture repair, radiation therapy, cataract surgery and other priority procedures.

item.title: Summary Statistics on Organ Transplants, Wait-Lists, and Donors, 2024
item.description: ​Data based on aggregate-level statistics received from Canada's 12 organ donation organizations.

item.title: Hospital Beds Staffed and In Operation, 2023–2024
item.description: These figures represent the beds and cribs available and staffed to provide services to inpatients at the required type and level of service during or at the beginning of the fiscal year.

item.title: Care for Children and Youth With Mental Disorders — Data Tables
item.description: The data tables contain information on emergency department visits, hospitalizations, physician visits and medications for children and youth age 5 to 24 with mental disorders.

item.title: CIHI Hospital Frailty Risk Measure, 2022-2023 to 2023-2024 - Data Tables
item.description: This data table provides aggregated results for the CIHI Hospital Frailty Risk Measure (HFRM) by hospital, health region, province/territory and all jurisdictions for 2022–2023 to 2023–2024.

item.title: Induced Abortions Reported in Canada — Annual data tables
item.description: These tables contain information on induced abortions in Canada from 2015 onward.

item.title: Induced Abortions Reported in Canada in 2023
item.description: ​These data tables provide information on induced abortions performed in a hospital or in a non-hospital setting in Canada. Volume breakdowns by age group and method of abortion are also included.

item.title: Profile of Clients in Home Care, 2023–2024
item.description: HCRS Quick Stats provide a profile of clients in home care in 2023-2024.

item.title: Hospitalization and Childbirth, 1995–1996 to 2023-2024 — Supplementary Statistics
item.description: ​These data tables contain information on hospitalization volumes, lengths of stay and standardized rates. Tables also include childbirth indicators by place of residence.

item.title: Inpatient Hospitalization, Surgery and Newborn Statistics, 2023-2024
item.description: ​​These data tables contain information on hospitalization rates, in-hospital births and the top reasons for hospitalizations and surgeries from the DAD and HMDB databases.

item.title: NACRS Emergency Department Visits and Lengths of Stay by Province/Territory, 2024–2025 (Q1 to Q2) — Provisional Data
item.description: Release of 2024–2025 provisional information on emergency department (ED) visits and lengths of stay by province and territory, based on data submitted to the National Ambulatory Care Reporting System (NACRS).

item.title: Health Workforce in Canada, 2019 to 2023: Overview — Data Tables
item.description: ​These data tables provide comparable information on 31 groups of health care professionals in Canada, including 5-year trends and demographic information.

item.title: Prescribed Drug Spending in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: Public drug program spending accounted for 44% of prescribed drug spending in Canada in 2021. Public drug program spending does not include spending on drugs dispensed in hospitals or on drugs funded through cancer agencies and other special programs.

item.title: Formulary Coverage in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: A formulary is a list of the drugs covered for eligible populations, and the type of coverage provided. Every public drug plan or program in Canada has a unique formulary.

item.title: Prescribed Drug Use Among Seniors in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: On average, seniors have a higher number of chronic conditions, and as a result they are prescribed a higher number of drugs than other age groups. The use of multiple drugs is associated with a higher risk of emergency department (ED) visits and…

item.title: Spending on High-Cost Drugs in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: Spending on high-cost chemicals (those with an average cost of $10,000 or more per person per year) accounts for a large proportion of total public drug program spending. Beneficiaries for whom a public drug program paid $10,000 or more can typically be…

item.title: Spending on Biologic Drugs in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: Biologic drugs, which are derived from living organisms, are structurally more complex and more expensive than traditional pharmaceuticals. Spending on biologics continues to increase in Canada, which has ranked third among Organisation for Economic Co-…

item.title: Drug Programs in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: Public drug plans/programs provide drug coverage for a specific population. Federal, provincial and territorial governments offer many different drug plans/programs, most of which have defined criteria for eligibility that include things like age, income…

item.title: Reimbursement Policies in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: Reimbursement policies specify the allowable limits that are placed on the costs for prescription drugs. These can include policies and limitations related to ingredient pricing, the maximum cost of generic drugs, coverage of drugs with lower-cost…

item.title: Markup Policies in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: Markup policies outline the maximum amount a pharmacy can add to the cost of a drug or ingredient, above the original cost. This amount is usually stated as a percentage of the cost.

item.title: Professional Fees in the Pharmaceutical Data Tool
item.description: Professional fees are the amount paid to a service provider for their services. They’re typically paid to a pharmacist and include dispensing fees, compounding fees or any other special service fees. Each jurisdiction has its own policies for these fees.

item.title: Treatment of End-Stage Organ Failure in Canada, Canadian Organ Replacement Register, 2014 to 2023: Dialysis and Pre-emptive Kidney Transplant — Data Tables
item.description: These data tables contain information about trends in dialysis and pre-emptive transplantation for end-stage kidney disease patients, including incidence, prevalence and survival.
